properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 15 at 8:15PM PST until January 16 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Spokane WA
properties.description:
...WINTER STORM TAKES AIM ON NORTH CENTRAL AND NORTHEAST
WASHINGTON AND THE NORTH IDAHO PANHANDLE...

.Our next winter storm will produce the heavy snow accumulations
over the north Cascades, Okanogan Valley, and the mountainous
portions of northeast Washington tonight into Thursday morning.
Accumulations of 5 to 8 inches will be common for counties along
the Canadian border.

* WHAT...Heavy snow. Total snow accumulation 5 to 9 inches valleys
and 6 to 12 inches in the mountains.

* WHERE...Sandpoint, Bonners Ferry, Priest River, Eastport, and
Schweitzer Mountain Road.

* WHEN...Until 4 PM PST Thursday.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Patchy blowing snow
could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous
conditions could impact the Thursday morning commute.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The heaviest snow will likely fall overnight
into the mid morning hours on Thursday. Additional light
snow will have the potential to produce additional light
accumulations Thursday afternoon.
properties.instruction:
If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in
your vehicle in case of an emergency.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST THURSDAY
